name: Academic Minds
description: Equipping young adults with effective study skills and methods that prepare them for success at university and beyond. The programme nurtures self-discipline, initiative and independence, helping students become confident self-starters. Hosted at Epsom College Malaysia.
what_to_bring:
üèïÔ∏è What to Bring to Summer Camp

‚Ä¢ Sleeping bag or bed roll (and a fitted sheet if you‚Äôre fancy)
‚Ä¢ Pill ow (yes, you‚Äôll miss it if you don‚Äôt bring it)
‚Ä¢ 5‚Äì7 sets of clothes ‚Äî comfy, washable, and ready for mud
‚Ä¢ Warm jumper or hoodie (nights get chilly, even heroes get cold)
‚Ä¢ Rain jacket or poncho (because nature doesn‚Äôt care about your plans)
‚Ä¢ Underwear and socks (more than you think you‚Äôll need)
‚Ä¢ Trainers or walking shoes
‚Ä¢ Flip-flops or slides (for showers and pool time)
‚Ä¢ Pyjamas
‚Ä¢ Hat or cap for sun protection
‚Ä¢ Reusable water bottle
‚Ä¢ Torch/flashlight (and spare batteries ‚Äî no, your phone torch doesn‚Äôt count)‚Ä¢
requirements:
‚úÖ Camp Requirements

‚Ä¢ To make sure everyone has a safe, fun, and unforgettable time, please read these carefully before arriving at camp.

ü©∫ Health & Safety

‚Ä¢ All campers must submit a completed health form at least 7 days before camp.
‚Ä¢ Medications must be clearly labeled and handed to staff during check-in.
‚Ä¢ Campers must be free from contagious illnesses for at least 48 hours before arrival.
‚Ä¢ Any allergies or medical conditions must be clearly listed ‚Äî no surprises, please.
‚Ä¢Sunscreen and insect repellent are strongly recommended (sunburn and mosquito bites aren‚Äôt badges of honor).

üôå Behaviour & Conduct

‚Ä¢ Treat everyone ‚Äî campers, staff, and squirrels ‚Äî with respect.
‚Ä¢ No bullying, teasing, or ‚Äúfunny‚Äù pranks that make someone else miserable.
‚Ä¢ Stay within camp boundaries unless supervised.
‚Ä¢Follow safety instructions during activities ‚Äî ignoring them = sitting out.
‚Ä¢ Phones and electronics may be collected during certain hours to promote actual conversation.

üïí Attendance & Check-In

‚Ä¢ Check-in: 2:00 PM ‚Äì 4:00 PM on Day 1.
‚Ä¢ Check-out: Campers must be signed out by a parent or guardian on the final day.
‚Ä¢ Please notify the camp office in advance if you‚Äôll arrive late or need early pick-up.

üßæ Insurance & Liability

‚Ä¢ All campers must have basic medical insurance coverage.
‚Ä¢ The camp is not responsible for lost, damaged, or mysteriously disappearing items ‚Äî pack wisely.
‚Ä¢ Leave valuables at home (this includes jewelry, gadgets, and your limited-edition sneakers).

üë¶üëß Age & Participation
‚Ä¢ Camp is open to ages 8‚Äì16 (unless otherwise stated).
‚Ä¢ All campers are expected to join in activities unless medically excused.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm tired‚Äù or ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like bugs‚Äù are not valid reasons to skip the fun.

highlights: ["üèïÔ∏è Outdoor Adventures","Daily hikes through stunning trails ‚Äî perfect for spotting wildlife (and testing your new boots).","Campfire nights with marshmallows, music, and embarrassing singalongs.","Water games, obstacle courses, and classic tug-of-war battles.","üé® Creative Zone","Art, crafts, and tie-dye sessions ‚Äî get messy, make magic, and take it home.","Drama, dance, and music workshops led by our energetic camp mentors.","Camp talent show ‚Äî where everyone‚Äôs a star (even if they forget the words).","‚öΩ Team Challenges","Sports tournaments for every skill level ‚Äî from football to frisbee.","Team-building games that test your brain, brawn, and ability to laugh at yourself.","Friendly competitions with prizes, pride, and plenty of bragging rights.","üåû Life Skills & Leadership","Learn how to start a fire (safely), pitch a tent, and make friends that last a lifetime.","Leadership and confidence workshops to build courage and independence.","Team challenges designed to help campers discover their inner trailblazer.","üéâ Unforgettable Moments","Theme nights, surprise events, and secret missions (don‚Äôt ask ‚Äî you‚Äôll find out).","The Great Camp Finale: games, awards, and a final campfire send-off you‚Äôll never forget.","Endless laughter, new friendships, and memories that‚Äôll outlast your tan."]

name: Wild Minds
description: Empowering young people to explore entrepreneurship, leadership and AI in creative, hands-on ways. They will apply these skills to understand our environment and sustainability and learn how innovation can shape a better future. For students aged 11-17.
what_to_bring:
Why choose the Wild Minds camp?
Campers will cultivate resilience, adaptability, and strategic thinking as they navigate complex scenarios and bring ideas to life. They‚Äôll strengthen their ability to collaborate across disciplines, communicate with clarity, and make decisions rooted in both data and values. With a strong emphasis on initiative and curiosity, the experience encourages students to think expansively, act with intention, and engage meaningfully with the world around them.


What‚Äôs Included:

Expert mentorship from leaders in technology and conservation
Engaging and innovative learning experiences
Chaperoned flights and all camp-related transportation will be provided throughout the specified camp dates, excluding arrival and departure
Full-board accommodation with rooms for up to three students, fostering team spirit
Skills for Life

Resilience, adaptability, critical thinking, collaboration, effective communication, and values-based decision-making
